com.kinvey
Class KinveyMetadata

java.lang.Object
  com.kinvey.KinveyMetadata

public class KinveyMetadata
extends Object

This class allows you fine-grained access control on a per-entity basis that override the default permissions of the collection.

Usage

To make use of the metadata provide a property in your MappedEntity of this type thats field mapping definition in MappedEntity.getMapping() corresponds to the FIELD_NAME. 
 public class MyEntity implements MappedEntity { 
      private String name;
      private KinveyMetadata meta; 
      
      public List<MappedField> getMapping() { 
          return Arrays.asList(new MappedField[] { new MappedField("name", "name"),
                                                  new MappedField("meta", KinveyMetadata.FIELD_NAME) 
                              }); 
          } 
      }

You have four options for each entity:

  • readers list - a list of users with read permissions
  • writers list - a list of users with read & write permissions
  • global read - any user can read the object
  • global write - any user can read & modify the object

Constructor Detail

KinveyMetadata

public KinveyMetadata(List<String> usersWithReadAccess,
                      List<String> usersWithWriteAccess,
                      Boolean globallyReadable,
                      Boolean globallyWritable,
                      KCSClient client)
Constructs a metadata object for purposes of creating new entities.

Parameters:
usersWithReadAccess - a list of user ids that should have read access
usersWithWriteAccess - a list of user ids that should have write access
globallyReadable - sets the global read flag
globallyWritable - sets the global write flag
client - used by the metadata to determine who the current user is

KinveyMetadata

protected KinveyMetadata(KCSClient client,
                         HashMap<String,Object> map)
Method Detail

hasWriteAccess

public boolean hasWriteAccess()
Checks whether the user is the creator or in the write access array.

Returns:
true if the user has write access, otherwise false.

An attribute that is controlled by the server.

Returns:
a string representing the server time this entity was last modified

public String getCreatorId()
The id of the user that created the entity. This _acl.creator from the metadata of the corresponding object.

the id of the user that created it

public void setUsersWithReadAccess(List<String> usersWithReadAccess)
Modify the list of users from the _acl.w json array. These users have read access to the object.

Parameters:
usersWithReadAccess - new list of users with read access

getUsersWithWriteAccess

public List<String> getUsersWithWriteAccess()
A list of users from the _acl.w json array. These users have been give exclusive access to write to the object.

Returns:
users with write access

setUsersWithWriteAccess

isGloballyReadable

public Boolean isGloballyReadable()
Boolean value that represents whether the object is readable by all users of the app. Returns null when the metadata property is unknown or not provided by the server.

Returns:
true if readable by users of the app, null if the property does not exist

isGloballyWritable

public Boolean isGloballyWritable()
Boolean value that represents whether the object is writable by all users of the app. Returns null when the metadata property is unknown or not provided by the server.

Returns:
true if writable by all users of the app, null if the property is not set.

getGloballyReadable

public Boolean getGloballyReadable()
Same as isGloballyReadable()

Returns:
true if the entity is readable by all users, otherwise false

getGloballyWritable

public Boolean getGloballyWritable()
Same as isGloballyWritable()

Returns:
true if the entity is writable by all users of the app, otherwise false

setGloballyWritable

public void setGloballyWritable(boolean writable)
Modify the boolean value that controls global write access to the entity.

Parameters:
writable - true if the desired result is to have the entity writable to all users within an app
